snippet: Anja Niedringhaus, a Pulitzer Prize-winning photographer for The Associated Press, was attacked in eastern Afghanistan as she traveled to cover preparations for the presidential vote.
abstract: Afghan police officer opens fire with machine gun, killing Pulitzer Prize-winning photographer Anja Niedringhaus and severely wounding veteran Associated Press reporter Kathy Gannon; journalists were traveling to eastern province of Khost to cover country's presidential elections, even as most foreigners had fled country to avoid surge in violence.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and FAROOQ JAN MANGAL
byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg reported from Kabul, and Farooq Jan Mangal from Khost Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Anja Niedringhaus, a Pulitzer Prize-winning photographer for The Associated Press, was attacked in eastern Afghanistan as she traveled to cover preparations for the presidential vote.

headline.main: Covering Afghan Vote, Until Shot by an Ally
headline.print_headline: Covering Afghan Vote, Until Shot by an Ally
